code.name: sample-code
code.content:
# Casino winnings from Monday to Friday
poker_vector <- c(140, -50, 20, -120, 240)
roulette_vector <- c(-24, -50, 100, -350, 10)
days_vector <- c("Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday")
names(poker_vector) <- days_vector
names(roulette_vector) <- days_vector

# Poker results of Wednesday: poker_wednesday


# Roulette results of Friday: roulette_friday

code.name: solution
code.content:
# Casino winnings from Monday to Friday
poker_vector <- c(140, -50, 20, -120, 240)
roulette_vector <- c(-24, -50, 100, -350, 10)
days_vector <- c("Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday")
names(poker_vector) <- days_vector
names(roulette_vector) <- days_vector

# Poker results of Wednesday: poker_wednesday
poker_wednesday <- poker_vector[3]

# Roulette results of Friday: roulette_friday
roulette_friday <- roulette_vector[5]

code.name: sct
code.content: msg = "Do not change anything about the definition and naming of `poker_vector` and `roulette_vector`."

specs.name: incorrect_msg
specs.content: "It looks like `poker_wednesday` does not contain the correct value of `poker_vector`."

specs.name: incorrect_msg
specs.content: "It looks like `roulette_friday` does not contain the correct value of `roulette_vector`."

specs.name: msg
specs.content: "Great! R also makes it possible to select multiple elements from a vector at once, remember? Put the theory to practice in the next exercise!"
